ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Shramik Bharti is a not-for-profit, grass root development organization registered under Societies Registration Act of 1860; Shramik Bhartiâ€™s activities are primarily aimed at eradicating poverty with particular emphasis on empowering women and disadvantaged communities. Established in 1986, Shramik Bharti is presently working with 125 slums and rural communities in 13 development blocks of Kanpur and Kanpur Dehat districts of Uttar Pradesh with a direct reach to more than 50,000 families. Mission Working for the empowerment of poor and under privileged, with special focus on women and children, Shramik Bharti facilities and fosters peopleâ€™s democratic institutions. Committed to a human development approach, Shramik Bharti facilitates to enlarge peopleâ€™s choices by assisting them in development of their capabilities and preparing them to have better control over their lives. Shramik Bharti is, therefore, a way of seeing and respecting people. Shramik Bhartiâ€™s programmes grow out of that respect and faith in idea of a truly democratic society, free from exploitations. Operational Strategy Guided by the mission, Shramik Bharti follows the following operational strategy: â€¢ Organising the community around socially relevant issues. â€¢ Developing their capacities for addressing the developmental issues and managing them. â€¢ Enabling access to services and provisions being provided by the state and market. â€¢ Aggregating the community based groups and facilitating them to emerge as community based organisations for continuing the interventions initiated by Shramik Bharti. Acheivements: â€¢ Shramik Bharti has promoted 1101 SHGs having 15405 members. â€¢ Shramik Bharti has formed 4 federations of SHGs. These federations are self managed and self sustainable. â€¢ Shramik Bharti has reclaimed 11,433 hectares of sodic land benefiting 30,355 small & marginal farmers. â€¢ Shramik Bharti has reclaimed sodic land of 205 small & marginal farmers by low cost biological method. â€¢ Promoted eri-silk rearing with 632 farmers in ravines of Yamuna. Cocoon produced is converted into yarn by two producer groups and the yarn is converted into fabric at the local level. â€¢ 585 small & marginal farmers have adopted Low External Input Sustainable Agriculture practices. â€¢ A group of 30 weavers in Garh have formed a producer society. Shramik Bharti has provided support for improving looms. Shramik Bharti is providing design and marketing support. â€¢ 300 families of equine owners have been organised in equine welfare groups for better care of their animals and improved income. â€¢ Conducted Family Planning education and services in a population of 600,000. â€¢ Promotion of Home Based Life Saving Skills for Safe Motherhood in a population of 350,000 in Kanpur Dehat. â€¢ Created HIV/AIDS awareness in a population of 350,000 population. â€¢ Sponsored 50 destitute elderly persons and distributing monthly ration, clothes, medical help on a regular basis since 1998. â€¢ Conducted Voter Awareness Campaign for Panchayat elections in 2005 in 135 panchayats. â€¢ Conducted training of elected panchayat leaders, ward members and community leaders on functioning of Panchayat Institutions.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The concept of WaSH, groups together water, sanitation, and hygiene because of the impact of deficiencies in each area, overlap strongly. Addressing these deficiencies together can achieve a strong positive impact on public health. To meet these goals Shramik Bharti Foundation has taken up this project with the support of UNICEF. This project provided an opportunity to ensure model WaSH facilities in 13 labor rooms of 5 districts of UP; Budaun, Shravasti, Balrampur, Mirzapur, and Sonbhadra.

The project has been proposed by Shramik Bharti Foundation for financial support scaling up of a project for self-employment generation of widows/disabled by providing them eco-friendly and smart roadside Mobile Water ATM. Mobile water ATMs will generate employment for the widows/ disabled which will empower them to be self- dependent and lead a life of self-respect.

In 2016-17, Shramik Bharti Foundation has worked on various aspects like Bio-sand water filter, Solar Home Lighting System with forced Draft Smokeless Cookstoves and Biogas in the districts of Uttar Pradesh and Punjab.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Shri Bhardwaj Gramodyog Sewa Sansthan (SBGSS) is a registered voluntary organisation under SRA 1860. It was registered in the year 1993 and since then it has been working in Maharajganj district. SBGSS is one of the leading voluntary organisation in Maharajganj district. Since last 15 years SBGSS has undertaken projects of various natures, such as Women Empowerment, Reproductive Child Health, Targeted Intervention, Water and Sanitation, Community Mobilization, Vocational Training to youth and girls. SBGSS has a well-established office space, manpower and technical expertise to implement developmental programmes not only in Maharajganj but also in other district of Tarai region of Uttar Pradesh. Secretary of the organisation hails from the Maharajganj and his early years he had studied the socio-politico-economic condition of the district. The prime objective of the organization are to work on the issued of rural health, sanitation, education, women empowerment, land and water management, poverty alleviation, agriculture development, cooperative movement and self help group formation through their innovative approach and mass mobilization. Since then the organization started their developmental journey with variety of the programmes such as community health, education, water and sanitation, and livelihood. In the end of the 21st century the due to border district and poverty, the emergence of HIV/AIDS changed the face of the district. In the prevailing situation the organization started earlier work against the AIDS awareness among the communities. In 2000 the organization started major work with support from Uttar Pradesh AIDS control Society and started the â€œTargeted Interventionâ€ project. Since then the organization promoted the rehabilitation of HIV+ and established their association (PLHA associations). Due to their remarkable work the organization having the excellent community image, the chief functionary of the organization representing in many district committees.
